item.title: Melt-in-Your-Mouth Peppermint Sugar Cookies for the Holidays
item.description: Indulge in these melt-in-your-mouth peppermint sugar cookies, a perfect blend of sweetness and minty freshness. Ideal for holiday gatherings, they are sure to impress your guests! | â±ï¸ Prep: 20min | Cook: 10min | Serves: 24 | #cat1761229889885 #easyrecipe #quickrecipe #30minutemeals #recipe
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 20 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 10 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 24

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 large egg
  • 1 teaspoon peppermint extract
  • 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup crushed peppermint candies
  • Powdered sugar for dusting

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C).
  2. In a large bowl, cream together the softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
  3. Beat in the egg and peppermint extract until well combined.
  4. In another bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
  5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
  6. Fold in the crushed peppermint candies.
  7. Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
  8. Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden.
  9. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.
  10. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

item.title: Moist Pumpkin Bread for Cozy Gatherings
item.description: This moist pumpkin bread is infused with cozy spices, making it perfect for gatherings or a comforting treat at home. Experience delightful aromas and flavors that warm the soul. | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 60min | Serves: 8 | #cat1761230383494 #easyrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 60 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
  • 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
  • 1/2 cup vegetable oil
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1/2 cup brown sugar
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 cup canned pumpkin puree
  • 1/4 cup water

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
  2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves.
  3. In a large bowl, mix the vegetable oil, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until well combined.
  4. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the pumpkin puree and water.
  5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
  6. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top.
  7. Bake for 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  8. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
